channel.title: CVE Feed for cyberchimps -- Responsive
channel.description: The latest CVEs for cyberchimps -- Responsive

item.title: CVE-2024-35654|2024-08-02T03:14:53.860Z -- cyberchimps -- responsive
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in CyberChimps Responsive allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Responsive: from n/a through 5.0.3.

item.title: CVE-2024-2848|2024-07-25T19:13:45.550Z -- cyberchimps -- responsive
item.description: The Responsive theme for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the save_footer_text_callback function in all versions up to, and including, 5.0.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary HTML content into the site's footer.

item.title: CVE-2024-2848|2024-03-29T11:02:02.771Z -- cyberchimps -- responsive
item.description: The Responsive theme for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the save_footer_text_callback function in all versions up to, and including, 5.0.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary HTML content into the site's footer.

item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in CyberChimps Responsive allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Responsive: from n/a through 5.0.3.

item.title: CVE-2024-2848|2024-08-01T19:25:42.142Z -- cyberchimps -- responsive
item.description: The Responsive theme for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the save_footer_text_callback function in all versions up to, and including, 5.0.2. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary HTML content into the site's footer.
